unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions

Class TerranMedic_MoveBackToBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaGOAP.GoapAction
      • unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions.BaseAction
        • unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions.TerranMedic_MoveBackToBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GroupableAction

    public class TerranMedic_MoveBackToBase
extends BaseAction
    TerranMedic_MoveBackToBase.java --- An Action with which a Terran_Medic can retreat to the nearest base. This is needed when no healable / followable Unit on the map exists. Using this action the Unit is prevented from simply standing around and not reacting at all or blocking other Units.
    Note:
    As soon as a Unit, that the executing one can support, is found on the map, this action stops being executable.
    Author:
    P H - 21.10.2017

      • followableUnitExists

        private boolean followableUnitExists(javaGOAP.IGoapUnit goapUnit)
        Function for testing if a healable / followable Unit exists on the map that the Terran_Medic can react to. This function excludes the UnitType.Terran_Medic since the action would otherwise not be performed when more than one single medic is on the map. Therefore only the other supportable UnitTypes are considered.
        Parameters:
        goapUnit - the executing Unit.
        Returns:
        true if a followable / healable Unit besides another Terran_Medic exists on the map.

        public boolean performGrouped(javaGOAP.IGoapUnit groupLeader,
                              javaGOAP.IGoapUnit groupMember)
        Description copied from interface: GroupableAction
        Function for actually performing the action as a group. This function is only called when mirroring the leader's action towards the other members of it's group and is not called for the leader himself.
        Parameters:
        groupLeader - reference to the leader of the group.
        groupMember - the current Unit that is mirroring the leader's action.
        Returns:
        true if the action was performed successfully, false if not.
